item.title: BNP to rehabilitate families of casualties from July Uprising if comes to power: Rizvi
item.description: BNP Senior Joint Secretary General Ruhul Kabir Rizvi today said the sacrifices made by the July fighters for the good of the state are unprecedented and if BNP comes to power in the upcoming election, the families of the martyrs and the injured will be rehabilitated. “If BNP is elected with

item.title: Bangladesh to celebrate Shab-e-Barat on Feb 3 night
item.description: The Muslim festival of Shab-e-Barat will be celebrated in Bangladesh on the night of Feb 3, according to the National Moon-Sighting Committee. The date was set in a meeting presided over by Md Kamal Uddin, secretary of the Ministry of Religious Affairs at the Islamic Foundation in the Baitul Mukar

item.title: 69 pc growth of remittance inflow till Jan 18
item.description: Inflow of remittances witnessed a year-on-year growth of 69 percent reaching US$2,040 million in the first 18 days of January, according to the latest data of Bangladesh Bank (BB) issued on Monday. Last year, during the same period, the country’s remittance inflow was $1,207million. During

item.title: RAB member killed in Sitakunda clash
item.description: A member of the Rapid Action Battalion (RAB) has been killed and three others critically injured in a gunfight with “local criminals” in Jungle Salimpur of Chattogram’s Sitakunda. The clash erupted on Monday afternoon during a RAB‑7 operation in the area. The dead has been ident

item.title: Forex reserves to exceed $35b by FY26: BB chief
item.description: Bangladesh Bank (BB) Governor Dr. Ahsan H. Mansur on Monday expressed strong optimism regarding the country’s macroeconomic stability, projecting that foreign currency reserves are on track to meet and surpass US$35 billion by the end of the current fiscal year 2025-26 (FY26). “Reachin

item.title: Student groups stage demo protesting postponement of SUST student union election
item.description: Students of Shahjalal University of Science and Technology (SUST) blocked the Sylhet-Sunamganj regional highway protesting the High Court order that postponed the first SUST students union election in almost 30 years, slated for Tuesday (Jan 20). Witnesses said the students brought out a processio

item.title: 10 injured in BNP activists’ fraternal clash in Jhenaidah
item.description: At least 10 individuals were injured in a clash between two BNP factions over establishing dominance in Shailkupa upazila of Jhenaidah on Monday morning. The incident took place at Bishnudia village under Manoharpur union. Police and local sources said supporters of district Jubo Dal joint genera

item.title: Administration penalised me thrice: Rumeen
item.description: Rumeen Farhana, the independent candidate for Brahmanbaria-2, has said the administration has “punished” her three times over an offence. She accused the election authorities of showing “bias” during a meeting with journalists at the Brahmanbaria Press Club on Monday. She

item.title: Tarique should face show-cause notice before others over electoral code violation, says NCP
item.description: The National Citizen Party (NCP) leaders have renewed their offensive against Tarique Rahman barely three weeks before the Feb 12 vote, saying the BNP supremo should be the first to explain the allegations of violating the election code of conduct. Their tirade against Tarique came minutes after t

item.title: Italian fashion designer Valentino has died, la Repubblica daily says
item.description: Italian fashion designer Valentino Garavani has died at the age of 93, newspaper la Repubblica and other Italian media said on Monday.

item.title: Politics should be about making people’s well-being, not blaming others: Tarique Rahman
item.description: Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) Chairman Tarique Rahman today said politics should not be about blaming others; rather, it must be about improving people’s lives. “Politics of blaming will not fill people’s stomachs. We don’t want to confine politics only to slogans, son

item.title: IMF tranche delay posed no threat to Bangladesh’s economy: BB Governor
item.description: Bangladesh’s economy has not suffered any adverse impact despite the delay in receiving the sixth tranche of the International Monetary Fund (IMF) loan, Bangladesh Bank Governor Ahsan H Mansur said on Monday, stressing that the country has managed the economic challenges on its own strength.
